info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:41PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Clay and northeastern Dunklin Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 541 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pollard, or near Chalk Bluff Natural Area, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malden, Piggott, Campbell, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Holcomb, St. Francis, Pollard, Saint Francis, Glennonville, Rhyne, Valley Ridge, Providence, Morris State Park, Wilhelmina, Brian, Chalk Bluff Battlefield Park, Baird, McGuires and Townley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and southeastern Missouri.
